sect1.title: Zend::register()
sect1.para: Registers a value in the registry.

The registry is a mechanism for providing singleton instances of values to the application space. By storing the value in the registry once, and then retrieving the value from the registry whenever it is needed, the same instance is always returned.
The $index is an arbitrary string to name the value in the store. This name will be supplied to Zend::registry() to retrieve the value again.
The semantics of the registry adhere to those of ArrayObject.
